title: Satisfaction Survey for Code.org's Professional Development Workshop

elements.name: intro_text
elements.html:
Well done, you've completed Code.org's professional development workshop!

This survey asks questions about your experience today. Your feedback is crucial to ensuring we best serve educators through continual program improvement.

Privacy and Confidentiality

  • Your individual responses here are completely confidential.
  • Your identity will never be revealed publicly or used to tie any responses back to you personally.
  • We may share de-identified, aggregate data (representing all responses) publicly.
  • Your de-identified responses will be used by Code.org, our Regional Partners, and our facilitators for program improvement.

elements.name: pd_content
elements.title: What content was the focus of the PD workshop you participated in?

choices.text: Teaching micro:bit Maker Module for Elementary
CSD Unit 1 - Problem Solving in Computing
CSD Unit 3 - Interactive Animations and Games
CSD Unit 6 - Creating Apps with Devices (Circuit Playground)
CSD Unit 6 - Creating Apps with Devices (micro:bit)
CSD Unit 7 - AI and Machine Learning

elements.name: workshop_date
elements.title: Please enter the date of the workshop you attended
elements.natalia_comment: NOTE: removed by adding visible statement as this question is no longer relevant for build your own workshops - 07/22/2024

elements.name: cdo_teaching_experience
elements.title: Which of the following options best captures your previous experience using Code.org in the classroom?

choices.text: I use Code.org to teach a computer science course
I use Code.org to introduce computer science when teaching other content
My students have done Hour of Code activities
I have not used Code.org in my classroom yet

elements.name: overall_success
elements.title: How much do you agree or disagree with the following statements about the workshop overall?

rows.text: I feel more prepared to teach the material covered in this workshop than before I came.
I am planning to teach this curriculum.
I know where to go if I need help preparing to teach this material.
I plan to incorporate into my teaching practices what I learned in this workshop.
This workshop motivated me to continue learning about computer science in education.
This professional development was suitable for my level of experience with teaching Computer Science.
I would recommend this professional development to others.

elements.name: barriers_implementation
elements.title: What do you perceive to be the most significant challenges in teaching this computer science curriculum in your classroom?
elements.natalia_comment: NOTE: removed by adding visible statement as this question is no longer relevant for build your own workshops - 07/22/2024

choices.text: I would like more preparation before teaching this content in my classroom
I have limited time to adopt new curriculum
I don't have enough support from my school's administration
My students don’t seem interested in computer science

elements.name: permission_quote
elements.title: I give Code.org permission to quote my written feedback from today for use on social media, promotional materials, and other communications.

choices.text: Yes, I give permission to quote me and use my name.

No, I do not give permission to quote me.

elements.name: thank_you
elements.html:
Thank You!

Thanks from Code.org for your time, thoughts, and passion for teaching.
